scenarioDescription:
The HD 98736 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 98736 is a star with 0.92 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.93 times its radius. It is located 105.82 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7.39 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 98736 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 98736 system


HD 98736 b

HD 98736 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2018-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.86 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 98736 b is 740.940 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 98736 b is 13.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 98736 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 98736, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 98736 - System With 1 Exoplanet
